channel.title: Talks on discrete blogarithm
channel.description: Recent content in Talks on discrete blogarithm

item.title: IRL or GTFO
item.description:
Scheduled talks:

  • Recurse Center, July 18-22, New York City (resident)
  • JSConf Budapest, May 12-13, Budapest
  • Fronteers, Apr. 1 2016, Amsterdam
  • People, Data & Power Workshop, Mar. 21 2016, Amsterdam (keynote)
  • Usenix Enigma Conference, Jan. 26 2016, San Francisco (co-presented with Peter Eckersley)
  • Stripe Tech Talks, Dec. 3 2015, San Francisco
  • CSAW 2015, Nov. 13 2015, New York City (Policy Competition judge)
  • Harlem CryptoParty, Nov. 12 2015, New York City
  • ToorCon 17, Oct. 25 2015, San Diego
  • SecretCon, Oct. 9 2015, New York City (keynote)
  • NGINX.conf, Sept. 23 2015, San Francisco
  • NCC Group Security Open Forum, Sept. 17 2015, San Francisco
  • FTC’s Start With Security, Sept. 9 2015, San Francisco (panelist)
  • DEF CON 23, Aug. 8 2015, Las Vegas (co-presented with James Kasten and Peter Eckersley)
  • TXJS, July 2015, Austin TX
  • Edge Conf 5, June 2015, London (opening speaker)
  • jQuerySF, June 2015, San Francisco
  • OWASP Irvine, June 2015, Irvine CA
  • Yahoo Trust UnConference, April 2015, San Francisco
  • SXSW, March 2015, Austin TX (co-presented with Alex Stamos in my first talk and was a panelist in my second)
  • Real World Crypto, Jan 2015, London (co-presented with Garrett Robinson)
  • Edge Conf 4, Sept. 2014, San Francisco (opening speaker)
  • DEF CON 22, Aug. 2014, Las Vegas (panelist)
  • HOPE X, July 2014, New York City (co-presented with Parker Higgins in my first talk and co-presented with Bill Budington and Garrett Robinson in my second)

Slides/video that might be cool, who knows:

  • Weird New Tricks for Browser Fingerprinting, ToorCon 2015 [Slides, Video]
  • JS and Security Get Married, NCC Group Open Forum [Slides]
  • Let’s Encrypt: Mining Free Certificates for The Entire Web, DEF CON 2015 [Slides, Video]
  • Weird Tricks to Improve Web Security 10000000%, TXJS 2015 and jQuerySF 2015 [Slides from TXJS, Video from jQuerySF]
  • Securing Email, Yahoo Trust Unconference 2015 [Slides, Video]
  • SecureDrop: A WikiLeaks in Every Newsroom, HOPE 2014 [Slides, Video]

Press coverage, awards, and other resume fillers:

  • The Ad-Blocking Hacker Making Your Browser More Paranoid
  • Gmail Android Bug Lets You Send Emails Pretending To Be Someone Else
  • Sniffly: covered in various places, #1 on Hacker News
  • ZEIT ONLINE: Kampf dem Klartext
  • Backdooring JS: front page of Hacker News and various subreddits
  • DuoSec: Presenting the 2015 Women in Security Awards
  • SC Magazine: Women in Security Issue
  • Yahoo! End-to-End Email Preview Promises Greater Protection for Journalists
  • Forbes 30 Under 30: Rising Stars of Enterprise Technology
  • Yahoo to roll out end-to-end email encryption
  • HTTP Must Die, Security Experts Tell Hackers
  • Yan Zhu: The Setup Interviews
  • Mathematicians Urge Colleagues to Refuse to Work for the NSA
  • Unsafe cookies leave WordPress accounts open to hijacking, 2-factor bypass
  • Cookies flaw lets hackers steal WordPress accounts
  • EFF’s new Privacy Badger add-on closes the prying eyes of online trackers
  • Meet SecureDrop, a New Lock Box for Whistleblowers
  • Browsing on your Android phone just got safer, thanks to the EFF
